results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 007
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Cherry trees yield a rich harvest; fruit pickers, sorters and packers handle the crop at Orange, NSW. Massed display of colourful dances at New Guinea, where five tribes gather; children learn early and adults decorate themselves with ochre, feathers, pearl shell and grass skirts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 041. Sydney Opera House
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Roland Beckett and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Progress report on the construction of the Opera House, with construction almost complete and fitting out well advanced. Includes views of the curtains of the sun and moon.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 040. The Vintage
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Frank Bagnall, Australian news and Information Bureau and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Reflects the growing industry of the Barossa Valley, in South Australia - one of Australia’s major wine producing areas. Settled by the Germans in the 1840’s, the valley has little towns of great charm. Around these early settlements, pioneers planted vines they had brought with them and many of their descendants continue to run family wineries. Photographed by Dean Semler.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Hannant, Frank Bagnall, Australian news and Information Bureau and Film Australia

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 039
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: This episode of the popular cinemagazine entitled “A Ticket to Sydney” shows the workers of Sydney on their journeys to the city by all forms of transport at morning break hours. There is no commentary in this production.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Hannant, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 038. Asian road
results.brief_description: Illustrates a Colombo Plan scheme being carried out in Thailand. Australia is helping to build a highway which will eventually cross Asia and link Teheran with Saigon. Each senior Thai engineer or technician has an Australian counterpart to assist with training and execution. Shows the conditions and difficult terrain which must be crossed.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 037. Country jazz
results.creator_credit: Bob Kingsbury, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The 25th Australian Jazz Convention, 1970, brought 600 musicians and enthusiasts to Dubbo, N.S.W. This annual event startled many of the local inhabitants, especially those who watched the parade of musicians down the main street. Featured artists and groups were the Original Graeme Bell Australian Jazz Band, Allan Stott’s Hottentots, Lachie Thompson’s New Whispering gold Orchestra, Nick Polites and his New Year’s Revllers and the Dubbo Corps Salvation Army Band.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 035. Port Moresby
results.brief_description: A day in the life of Port Moresby, the capital city of Papua New Guinea. Shows early morning arrivals of fish, fruit and vegetables at the market, the flow of traffic into the city centre, the modern office buildings, indigenous buildings and artifacts, and finally people leaving work and relaxing on the beach.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 033. Who's for tennis?
results.brief_description: Looks at the interest shown in tennis in Australia from children learning the basics of the game, to champions such as Emerson and Roche playing off in competition at the White City Courts. Fresh air, exercise and making new friends attract people to the game.
results.description: Looks at the interest shown in tennis in Australia from children learning the basics of the game, to champions such as Emerson and Roche playing off in competition at the White City Courts. Fresh air, exercise and making new friends attract people to the game.
